You are given two images. The first image is the source viewpoint, and the second image is the target viewpoint. From source viewpoint to target viewpoint, the camera is moving around, i.e., with translation and rotation.
</input>

<task>
Your task is to infer the camera motion from the source viewpoint to the target viewpoint. You are given some answer candidates, and you need to select the most appropriate one in describing the camera motion in translation or rotation.
</task>

<objects>
Please compare the position of following objects in the source viewpoint and target viewpoint. They can be the reference objects to help you understand the camera motion.
1: White Sink
</objects>

<hint>
1: The White Sink is in a front-view in the source viewpoint and a right-view in the target viewpoint.
</hint>

<answer-candidates>
0. Leftward Translation - The camera translates leftward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
1. Rightward Translation - The camera translates rightward from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
</answer-candidates>

<output-format>
Please output your reasoning in <rsn></rsn> XML tags first, and then output the index of the answer-candidate you choose in <ans></ans> XML tags. Do not output any other text.
</output-format>
answer:
<rsn>
The White Sink is positioned directly in front of the camera in the source viewpoint, showing it from a front view. In the target viewpoint, the sink is shown from a side view, indicating that the camera has rotated to the right to capture this perspective. There is no indication of a leftward or rightward translation; rather, the change in angle suggests a rotational movement.
</rsn>
<ans>1</ans>
rsn: The White Sink is positioned directly in front of the camera in the source viewpoint, showing it from a front view. In the target viewpoint, the sink is shown from a side view, indicating that the camera has rotated to the right to capture this perspective. There is no indication of a leftward or rightward translation; rather, the change in angle suggests a rotational movement.
